thread.title: Tim Minchin's Matilda the Musical is moving to Melbourne in March
thread.title_full: Tim Minchin's Matilda the Musical is moving to Melbourne in March

author: Karl Quinn
title: Tim Minchin's Matilda the Musical is moving to Melbourne in March
text:
Click to play video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Video will begin in 5 seconds.
Don't play Play now More video Recommended Replay video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Matilda the Musical Matilda is the musical of Roald Dahl's book about the anarchy of childhood, the power of imagination and one inspiring girl who dares to change her destiny.
PT2M3S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-3w7fj 620 349 May 18, 2015 Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Minchin's Matilda is moving to Melbourne in March.
In news long expected in the theatre world , it has been confirmed that Matilda the Musical, the multi-award-winning stage show adapted from Roald Dahl' children's book, will open at Melbourne's Princess Theatre on March 13, 2016, six weeks after its Sydney season ends on January 31.
The show was originally created by the UK's Royal Shakespeare Company and unveiled in November 2010. Perth-raised (and formerly Melbourne-based) comedian-actor-writer Tim Minchin wrote the music and lyrics and Dennis Kelly wrote the book.
Matilda the Musical is coming to Melbourne. Photo: James Morgan 
The show has been almost universally revered wherever it has played.
Advertisement Sydney Morning Herald theatre critic John Shand gave the show four-and-a-half stars (out of five) when it opened in August.
"The miracle of Matilda the Musical is not that it offers burp jokes and mock horror to transfix the young and shrewder entertainment for adults, but that it turns grown-ups back into kids" Shand wrote. "The years roll back like some mist, and you feel that long-lost sense of wonder as well as being caught up in the mad contagion of fun."
Matilda swept the Olivier Awards in 2012 after moving from the RSC's hometown, Stratford-upon-Avon, to London's West End, winning a record-equalling seven awards. On Broadway, it won four Tony awards in 2013, while the four girls who performed the title role on rotation also received an honorary awards for excellence in theatre.
Tim Minchin has been overwhelmed by the success of Matilda the Musical . Photo: Mark Kolbe 
The show is still running in both London and New York, and in a touring production in the US. No end date for the Melbourne season has been announced, though it is slated to run for a "strictly limited" time. Tickets go on sale October 20.
